title: Rich Lister rock: Singo's singalong with Kris Kristofferson
text:
The singer-songwriter wrote Me and Bobby McGee, performed by Janis Joplin, along with other chart toppers for the likes of Jerry Lee Lewis, Waylon Jennings and Johnny Cash. A man of many talents, Kristofferson was also a Rhodes scholar.

Me and Kris Kristofferson ... Gerry Harvey tries out his guitar at Saddles restaurant. Kate Geraghty

“My wife is only 58 and she knows a lot more about music than me, but when I told her I was off to see Kris Kristofferson, she said: ‘Who’s that?’” a bemused Blackmore told The Australian Financial Review.

“These young ones – they don’t know much,” chimed in Cowin.

Kris Kristofferson and Barbra Streisand starred in the movie A Star Is Born in 1976. Warner Bros

The tickets are priced at $1500 for a single seat or $10 000 for a table of 10 seats, and once Kristofferson has taken his cut, Singleton and Saddles' restaurateurs, husband and wife team Hayley Hardcastle and Cameron Cansdell, will at least break even as the 100 places have all sold out.

Saddles is the smallest audience Kristofferson has played to while in Australia.

Singleton’s sale of his 32.4 per cent stake in Macquarie Media to Nine (which owns the Financial Review) will no doubt give his 2020 Rich List prospects a boost.

Nine is paying $113.9 million for the remaining 45.5 per cent of Macquarie Media, which includes a stable of talkback radio hosts: Alan Jones, Ray Hadley, Steve Price and Neil Mitchell.

In more good news for Singleton, his Saddles restaurant was nominated this year one of the world’s most beautiful restaurants by Conde Nast Traveller.

"It's incredible to have Kris play here," Singleton said. "It's the perfect venue for his brilliant music. We want to do a lot more performances like this; it's such a beautiful space for it."
description: Rich Listers don't die – they just fly in 83-year-old rockers.
